description: Related, led by Jorge Pérez and his sons, Jon Paul and Nick, plan a three-tower development including the 75-story Baccarat-branded condo high-rise and hotel. Baccarat Residences will include 318 condos, eight penthouses and 28 riverfront flats and duplexes, according to Related’s website.
Related Group and Integra Investments plan one 46-story St. Regis-branded tower totaling roughly 150 condos.
Mast Capital plans a new 80-story condo tower, the first Cipriani-branded residential building in the U.S. It is expected to have 397 units, according to a press release.

Rosso and Midtown Development plan the Standard Residences in Midtown Miami, a 12-story condo tower with 228-unit project. Rosso Development's Carlos Rosso has partnered with Alex Vadia's Midtown Development on the project.
Terra plans the Mr. C Residences in Coconut Grove. Starting prices for the 20-story, 118-condo development begin at $600,000 and run to $5 million.

Bel Invest and its partner, Diesel, plan the Diesel Wynwood condo tower in Miami's Wynwood neighborhood. The tower will be eight-stories and have 159 units. It will be the first Diesel branded condo tower, ever.
G&G Business Developments plan the Aston Martin Residences in Miami, a 66-story, 391-unit condo tower.

full_address: 18401 Collins Avenue in Sunny Isles Beach
description: Dezer Development plans a 61-story condo tower with 216 units. Dezer partnered with Bentley Motors to develop the luxury automotive brand’s first residential building in the world.

developers: PMG, Greybrook, Mohari Hospitality, S2 Development and Hilton
description: PMG, Greybook, Mohari Hospitality, S2 Development and Hilton plan the Waldorf Astoria, a 100-story tower with 360 condos and 205 hotel rooms.

full_address:
20 Northeast 11th St, Miami

29 Northeast 11th St, Miami
project_name: E11even Residences and E11even Residences Beyond
description: PMG, E11even Partners plan the E11even Residences and E11even Residences Beyond, two E11even-branded condo towers in Park West. The first tower will have 65 stories and 400 units. The second tower will have 461 units.

Fortune International Group plans a luxury Casa Tua condo tower in Miami’s Brickell neighborhood that will allow short-term rentals. The project, Ora by Casa Tua, is a 70-story, roughly 460-unit development.

Two Roads Development is partnering with the Edition brand for the first of a three-tower luxury condo project in Miami’s Edgewater neighborhood. Sales of the planned 185-unit, 55-story Edition Residences at 2121 North Bayshore Drive have already begun.

Rishi Kapoor of Coral Gables-based Location Ventures signed a licensing and branding agreement with Marriott International for two Edition-branded condo towers. The two 11-story buildings will have a total of 65 units.
Related Group and Alta Developers plan Casa Bella, a B&B Italia branded condo tower.
Related Group and David Edelstein’s Tricap plan a 329-unit, nine-story building at 2700 Northwest Second Avenue in Miami's Wynwood neighborhood.

developers: OKO Group, backed by Access Industries
description: Billionaires Vlad Doronin and Len Blavatnik want to build the first Aman-branded development in South Florida at 3425 Collins Avenue, a proposed 56-key hotel and 23 luxury condos.

project_name: Auberge Residences at the Shore Club
description: Witkoff and Monroe Capital plan the Auberge Residences at the Shore Club, a 17-story tower with 49-units. Douglas Elliman will lead sales of the Auberge-branded hotel and development.
Rosewood will manage the 60-key oceanfront hotel and brand the 17-story, 44-unit condo tower planned by Michael Shvo's Raleigh development in Miami Beach.

full_address: 11551 Ellison Wilson Road, North Palm Beach
project_name: The Ritz-Carlton Residences Palm Beach Gardens
description: The Catalfumo Companies project, formerly known as the Landing at PGA Waterway, will now be the Ritz-Carlton Residences, developed by Dan Catalfumo.

developers: Fortune International Group and Oak Capital
description: Fortune International Group and Oak Capital, the firm led by former Lionheart Capital principal Ricardo Dunin, plan a two-tower, 205-unit waterfront luxury condo development.

project_name: The Residences at Shell Bay by Auberge Resorts Collection
description: PPG Development and Witkoff plan the Residences at Shell Bay by Auberge Resorts.

Damac Properties plans Cavalli-branded condos on the Surfside Collapse site, most likely making the project one of the most controversial in the county. It is the final resting place for 98 people who died in the collapse. The number of stories or units isn't yet known.

developers: OKO Group, OB Group and Cain International
description: OKO Group, Oleg Baybakov’s OB Group and Cain International are developing the 57-story, 249-unit building at 777 Northeast 26th Terrace, which is nearly completed.
